com.moomoohk.MooCommands

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moomoohk.MooCommands.Command
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HelpCommand

    public abstract class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class represents an executable command.
    Since:
    2013-11-24
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Meshulam Silk (moomoohk@ymail.com)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Command()
      Creates a new Command object and adds it to the CommandsManager list.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String checkAndExecute(java.lang.String[] params)
      This method will check the validity of the parameters and execute it if the check is successful.
      abstract java.lang.String getCommand()
      Gets this command as a String.
      abstract java.lang.String getHelpMessage()
      Gets this command's help message.
      abstract int getMaxParams()
      Gets the maximum number of parameters this command can be used with.
      abstract int getMinParams()
      Gets the minimum number of parameters this command can be used with.
      java.awt.Color getOutputColor()
      Gets the color that this command's output text should be printed with.
      abstract java.lang.String getUsage()
      Gets the proper usage of this command.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String containing information about this command using the following format:
      [This command as a String]: [This command's help message or "" if none specified], Usage: [This command's usage or "" if none specified]

        public abstract java.lang.String getUsage()
        Gets the proper usage of this command.

      • getMaxParams

        public abstract int getMaxParams()
        Gets the maximum number of parameters this command can be used with. -1 for infinite.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of parameters this command can be used with. -1 for infinite.

      • getMinParams

        public abstract int getMinParams()
        Gets the minimum number of parameters this command can be used with.
        Returns:
        The minimum number of parameters this command be used with.

      • getOutputColor

        public java.awt.Color getOutputColor()
        Gets the color that this command's output text should be printed with.

        For example, suppose the command's output text indicates that some error has occurred, the color returned would be red.
        This color doesn't matter unless this command's output is being printed with a colored text compatible handler.

        Returns:
        The color that this command's output text should be printed with.

      • checkAndExecute

        public java.lang.String checkAndExecute(java.lang.String[] params)
        This method will check the validity of the parameters and execute it if the check is successful.
        Parameters:
        params - A String array of the parameters you'd like to execute this command with.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String containing information about this command using the following format:
        [This command as a String]: [This command's help message or "" if none specified], Usage: [This command's usage or "" if none specified]
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String containing information about this command.
